get.summary:
pool: `listauth`
GetLsatTokens returns all LSAT tokens the daemon ever paid for.

pool: `accounts list`
ListAccounts returns a list of all accounts known to the trader daemon and
their current state.

parameters.name: active_only
parameters.description: Only list accounts that are still active.

delete.summary:
pool: `accounts close`
CloseAccount closes an account and returns the funds locked in that account
to the connected lnd node's wallet.

parameters.name: trader_key
parameters.description: The trader key associated with the account that will be closed.

parameters.name: output_with_fee.address
parameters.description: The address corresponding to the output.

parameters.name: output_with_fee.conf_target
parameters.description: The target number of blocks that the transaction should be confirmed in.

parameters.name: output_with_fee.fee_rate_sat_per_kw
parameters.description: The fee rate, in satoshis per kw, to use for the withdrawal transaction.

post.summary:
pool: `accounts new`
InitAccount creates a new account with the requested size and expiration,
funding it from the wallet of the connected lnd node.

pool: `accounts bumpfee`
BumpAccountFee attempts to bump the fee of an account's transaction through
child-pays-for-parent (CPFP). Since the CPFP is performed through the
backing lnd node, the account transaction must contain an output under its
control for a successful bump. If a CPFP has already been performed for an
account, and this RPC is invoked again, then a replacing transaction (RBF)
of the child will be broadcast.

pool: `accounts deposit`
DepositAccount adds more funds from the connected lnd node's wallet to an
account.

QuoteAccount gets a fee quote to fund an account of the given size with the
given confirmation target. If the connected lnd wallet doesn't have enough
balance to fund an account of the requested size, an error is returned.

pool: `accounts recover`
RecoverAccounts queries the auction server for this trader daemon's accounts
in case we lost our local account database.

pool: `accounts renew`
RenewAccount renews the expiration of an account.

pool: `accounts withdraw`
WithdrawAccount splits off parts of the account balance into the specified
outputs while recreating the account with a reduced balance.

get.summary:
pool: `auction nextbatchinfo`
NextBatchInfo returns information about the next batch the auctioneer will
perform.

pool: `auction snapshot`
BatchSnapshot returns the snapshot of a past batch identified by its ID.
If no ID is provided, the snapshot of the last finalized batch is returned.
Deprecated, use BatchSnapshots instead.

parameters.name: batch_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the batch encoded as a compressed pubkey.

get.summary:
pool: `auction snapshot`
BatchSnapshots returns a list of batch snapshots starting at the start batch
ID and going back through the history of batches, returning at most the
number of specified batches. A maximum of 100 snapshots can be queried in
one call. If no start batch ID is provided, the most recent finalized batch
is used as the starting point to go back from.

parameters.name: start_batch_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the first batch to return, encoded as a compressed
pubkey. This represents the newest/most current batch to fetch. If this is
empty or a zero batch ID, the most recent finalized batch is used as the
starting point to go back from.

parameters.name: num_batches_back
parameters.description: The number of batches to return at most, including the start batch.

get.summary:
pool: `auction snapshot`
BatchSnapshots returns a list of batch snapshots starting at the start batch
ID and going back through the history of batches, returning at most the
number of specified batches. A maximum of 100 snapshots can be queried in
one call. If no start batch ID is provided, the most recent finalized batch
is used as the starting point to go back from.

parameters.name: start_batch_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the first batch to return, encoded as a compressed
pubkey. This represents the newest/most current batch to fetch. If this is
empty or a zero batch ID, the most recent finalized batch is used as the
starting point to go back from.

parameters.name: num_batches_back
parameters.description: The number of batches to return at most, including the start batch.

get.summary:
pool: `auction snapshot`
BatchSnapshots returns a list of batch snapshots starting at the start batch
ID and going back through the history of batches, returning at most the
number of specified batches. A maximum of 100 snapshots can be queried in
one call. If no start batch ID is provided, the most recent finalized batch
is used as the starting point to go back from.

parameters.name: start_batch_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier of the first batch to return, encoded as a compressed
pubkey. This represents the newest/most current batch to fetch. If this is
empty or a zero batch ID, the most recent finalized batch is used as the
starting point to go back from.

parameters.name: num_batches_back
parameters.description: The number of batches to return at most, including the start batch.

get.summary:
pool: `auction fee`
AuctionFee returns the current auction order execution fee specified by the
auction server.

pool: `getinfo`
GetInfo returns general information about the state of the Pool trader
daemon.

pool: `auction leasedurations`
LeaseDurations returns the current set of valid lease duration in the
market as is, and also information w.r.t if the market is currently active.

pool: `auction leases`
Leases returns the list of channels that were either purchased or sold by
the trader within the auction.

parameters.name: batch_ids
parameters.description:
An optional list of batches to retrieve the leases of. If empty, leases
throughout all batches are returned.

parameters.name: accounts
parameters.description:
An optional list of accounts to retrieve the leases of. If empty, leases
for all accounts are returned.

get.summary:
pool: `auction ratings`
Returns the Node Tier information for this target Lightning node, and other
related ranking information.

parameters.name: node_pubkeys
parameters.description: The target node to obtain ratings information for.

get.summary:
pool: `orders list`
ListOrders returns a list of all active and archived orders that are
currently known to the trader daemon.

parameters.name: verbose
parameters.description:
Can be set to true to list the orders including all events, which can be
very verbose.

parameters.name: active_only
parameters.description: Only list orders that are still active.

post.summary:
pool: `orders submit`
SubmitOrder creates a new ask or bid order and submits for the given account
and submits it to the auction server for matching.

delete.summary:
pool: `orders cancel`
CancelOrder cancels an active order with the auction server to remove it
from future matching.

post.summary:
pool: `sidecar expect-channel`
ExpectSidecarChannel is step 4/4 of the sidecar negotiation between the
provider (the trader submitting the bid order) and the recipient (the trader
receiving the sidecar channel).
This step must be run by the recipient once the provider has submitted the
bid order for the sidecar channel. From this point onwards the Pool trader
daemon of both the provider as well as the recipient need to be online to
receive and react to match making events from the server.

pool: `sidecar offer`
OfferSidecar is step 1/4 of the sidecar negotiation between the provider
(the trader submitting the bid order) and the recipient (the trader
receiving the sidecar channel).
This step must be run by the provider. The result is a sidecar ticket with
an offer to lease a sidecar channel for the recipient. The offer will be
signed with the provider's lnd node public key. The ticket returned by this
call will have the state "offered".

pool: `sidecar register`
RegisterSidecarRequest is step 2/4 of the sidecar negotiation between the
provider (the trader submitting the bid order) and the recipient (the trader
receiving the sidecar channel).
This step must be run by the recipient. The result is a sidecar ticket with
the recipient's node information and channel funding multisig pubkey filled
in. The ticket returned by this call will have the state "registered".

pool: `stop`
Stop gracefully shuts down the Pool trader daemon.

trader_key.description:
The identifying component of an account. This is the key used for the trader
in the 2-of-2 multi-sig construction of an account with an auctioneer.

outpoint.description:
The current outpoint associated with the account. This will change every
time the account has been updated.

value.description: The current total amount of satoshis in the account.

available_balance.description:
The amount of satoshis in the account that is available, meaning not
allocated to any oustanding orders.

expiration_height.description: The height at which the account will expire.

state.description: The current state of the account.

latest_txid.description: The hash of the account's latest transaction.

poolrpcAccountState.description:
- PENDING_OPEN: The state of an account when it is pending its confirmation on-chain.
 - PENDING_UPDATE: The state of an account when it has undergone an update on-chain either as
part of a matched order or a trader modification and it is pending its
confirmation on-chain.
 - OPEN: The state of an account once it has confirmed on-chain.
 - EXPIRED: The state of an account once its expiration has been reached and its closing
transaction has confirmed.
 - PENDING_CLOSED: The state of an account when we're waiting for the closing transaction of
an account to confirm that required cooperation with the auctioneer.
 - CLOSED: The state of an account once its closing transaction has confirmed.
 - RECOVERY_FAILED: The state of an account that indicates that the account was attempted to be
recovered but failed because the opening transaction wasn't found by lnd.
This could be because it was never published or it never confirmed. Then the
funds are SAFU and the account can be considered to never have been opened
in the first place.
 - PENDING_BATCH: The account has recently participated in a batch and is not yet confirmed.

details.description: The common fields shared between both ask and bid order types.

lease_duration_blocks.description:
The number of blocks the liquidity provider is willing to provide the
channel funds for.

version.description:
The version of the order format that is used. Will be increased once new
features are added.

lease_duration_blocks.description: The period of time the channel will survive for.

rate_fixed.description: The true bid price of the order in parts per billion.

chan_type.description: The channel type to be created.

execution_fee.description: The execution fee charged per matched order.

batch_id.description: The unique identifier of the batch.

prev_batch_id.description: The unique identifier of the prior batch.

batch_tx_id.description: The txid of the batch transaction.

batch_tx.description: The batch transaction including all witness data.

batch_tx_fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description: The fee rate, in satoshis per kiloweight, of the batch transaction.

creation_timestamp_ns.description: The unix timestamp in nanoseconds the batch was made.

matched_markets.description:
Maps the distinct lease duration markets to the orders that were matched
within and the discovered market clearing price.

details.description: The common fields shared between both ask and bid order types.

lease_duration_blocks.description:
Required number of blocks that a channel opened as a result of this bid
should be kept open.

version.description:
The version of the order format that is used. Will be increased once new
features are added.

min_node_tier.description:
The minimum node tier this order should be matched with. Only asks backed by
a node this tier or higher will be eligible for matching with this bid.

self_chan_balance.description:
Give the incoming channel that results from this bid being matched an
initial outbound balance by adding additional funds from the taker's account
into the channel. As a simplification for the execution protocol and the
channel reserve calculations, the self_chan_balance can be at most the same
as the order amount and the min_chan_amt must be set to the full order
amount.

sidecar_ticket.description:
If this bid order is meant to lease a channel for another node (which is
dubbed a "sidecar channel") then this ticket contains all information
required for setting up that sidecar channel. The ticket is expected to be
the base64 encoded ticket, including the prefix and the checksum.

lease_duration_blocks.description: The period of time the matched channel should be allocated for.

rate_fixed.description: The true bid price of the order in parts per billion.

chan_type.description: The channel type to be created.

trader_key.description: The trader key associated with the account that will have its fee bumped.

fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description:
The new fee rate, in satoshis per kw, to use for the child of the account
transaction.

close_txid.description: The hash of the closing transaction.

trader_key.description:
The trader key associated with the account that funds will be deposited
into.

amount_sat.description: The amount in satoshis to deposit into the account.

fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description: The fee rate, in satoshis per kw, to use for the deposit transaction.

account.description: The state of the account after processing the deposit.

deposit_txid.description: The transaction used to deposit funds into the account.

poolrpcDurationBucketState.description:
- NO_MARKET: NO_MARKET indicates that this bucket doesn't actually exist, in that no
market is present for this market.
 - MARKET_CLOSED: MARKET_CLOSED indicates that this market exists, but that it isn't currently
running.
 - ACCEPTING_ORDERS: ACCEPTING_ORDERS indicates that we're accepting orders for this bucket, but
not yet clearing for this duration.
 - MARKET_OPEN: MARKET_OPEN indicates that we're accepting orders, and fully clearing the
market for this duration.

base_fee.description: The base fee in satoshis charged per order, regardless of the matched size.

fee_rate.description: The fee rate in parts per million.

ticket.description:
The sidecar ticket to expect an incoming channel for. The ticket must be in
the state "ordered".

version.description: The version of the Pool daemon that is running.

accounts_total.description: The total number of accounts in the local database.

accounts_active.description:
The total number of accounts that are in an active, non-archived state,
including expired accounts.

accounts_active_expired.description: The total number of accounts that are active but have expired.

accounts_archived.description: The total number of accounts that are in an archived/closed state.

orders_total.description: The total number of orders in the local database.

orders_active.description:
The total number of active/pending orders that are still waiting for
execution.

orders_archived.description: The total number of orders that have been archived.

current_block_height.description: The current block height as seen by the connected lnd node.

batches_involved.description: The number of batches an account of this node was ever involved in.

node_rating.description: Our lnd node's rating as judged by the auctioneer server.

lsat_tokens.description: The number of available LSAT tokens.

subscribed_to_auctioneer.description:
Indicates whether there is an active subscription connection to the
auctioneer. This will never be true if there is no active account. If there
are active accounts, this value represents the network connection status to
the auctioneer server.

new_nodes_only.description:
Indicates whether the global `--newnodesonly` command line flag or
`newnodesonly=true` configuration parameter was set on the Pool trader
daemon.

market_info.description:
A map of all markets identified by their lease duration and the current
set of statistics such as number of open orders and total units of open
interest.

conf_target.description: The target number of blocks that the transaction should be confirmed in.

initiator.description:
An optional identification string that will be appended to the user agent
string sent to the server to give information about the usage of pool. This
initiator part is meant for user interfaces to add their name to give the
full picture of the binary used (poold, LiT) and the method used for opening
the account (pool CLI, LiT UI, other 3rd party UI).

channel_point.description: The outpoint of the channel created.

channel_amt_sat.description: The amount, in satoshis, of the channel created.

channel_duration_blocks.description: The intended duration, in blocks, of the channel created.

channel_lease_expiry.description: The absolute height that this channel lease expires.

premium_sat.description: The premium, in satoshis, either paid or received for the offered liquidity.

execution_fee_sat.description:
The execution fee, in satoshis, charged by the auctioneer for the channel
created.

chain_fee_sat.description:
The fee, in satoshis, charged by the auctioneer for the batch execution
transaction that created this lease.

clearing_rate_price.description:
The actual fixed rate expressed in parts per billionth this lease was
bought/sold at.

order_fixed_rate.description:
The actual fixed rate of the bid/ask, this should always be 'better' than
the clearing_rate_price.

order_nonce.description: The order executed that resulted in the channel created.

purchased.description: Whether this channel was purchased from another trader or not.

channel_remote_node_key.description: The pubkey of the node that this channel was bought/sold from.

channel_node_tier.description: The tier of the node that this channel was bought/sold from.

lease_duration_buckets.description:
The set of lease durations the market is currently accepting and the state
the duration buckets currently are in.

leases.description: The relevant list of leases purchased or sold within the auction.

total_amt_earned_sat.description: The total amount of satoshis earned from the leases returned.

total_amt_paid_sat.description: The total amount of satoshis paid for the leases returned.

base_macaroon.description:
*
The base macaroon that was baked by the auth server.

payment_hash.description:
*
The payment hash of the payment that was paid to obtain the token.

payment_preimage.description:
*
The preimage of the payment hash, knowledge of this is proof that the
payment has been paid. If the preimage is set to all zeros, this means the
payment is still pending and the token is not yet fully valid.

amount_paid_msat.description:
*
The amount of millisatoshis that was paid to get the token.

routing_fee_paid_msat.description:
*
The amount of millisatoshis paid in routing fee to pay for the token.

time_created.description:
*
The creation time of the token as UNIX timestamp in seconds.

expired.description:
*
Indicates whether the token is expired or still valid.

storage_name.description:
*
Identifying attribute of this token in the store. Currently represents the
file name of the token where it's stored on the file system.

num_asks.description: The number of open/pending ask orders per node tier.

num_bids.description: The number of open/pending bid orders per node tier.

ask_open_interest_units.description:
The total number of open/unmatched units in open/pending ask orders per node
tier.

bid_open_interest_units.description:
The total number of open/unmatched units in open/pending bid orders per node
tier.

match_state.description: The state of the match making process the order went through.

units_filled.description: The number of units that would be (or were) filled with this match.

matched_order.description: The nonce of the order we were matched to.

reject_reason.description:
The reason why the trader daemon rejected the order. Is only set if
match_state is set to REJECTED.

poolrpcMatchRejectReason.description:
- NONE: No reject occurred, this is the default value.
 - SERVER_MISBEHAVIOR: The client didn't come up with the same result as the server and is
rejecting the batch because of that.
 - BATCH_VERSION_MISMATCH: The client doesn't support the current batch verification version the
server is using.
 - PARTIAL_REJECT_COLLATERAL: The client rejects some of the orders, not the full batch. This reason is
set on matches for orders that were in the same batch as partial reject ones
but were not themselves rejected.
 - PARTIAL_REJECT_DUPLICATE_PEER: The trader's client has a preference to only match orders with peers it
doesn't already have channels with. The order that is rejected with this
reason type comes from a peer that the trader already has channels with.
 - PARTIAL_REJECT_CHANNEL_FUNDING_FAILED: The trader's client couldn't connect to the remote node of the matched
order or the channel funding could not be initialized for another
reason. This could also be the rejecting node's fault if their
connection is not stable. Using this code can have a negative impact on
the reputation score of both nodes, depending on the number of errors
recorded.

poolrpcMatchState.description:
- PREPARE: The OrderMatchPrepare message from the auctioneer was received initially.
 - ACCEPTED: The OrderMatchPrepare message from the auctioneer was processed successfully
and the batch was accepted.
 - REJECTED: The order was rejected by the trader daemon, either as an answer to a
OrderMatchSignBegin or OrderMatchFinalize message from the auctioneer.
 - SIGNED: The OrderMatchSignBegin message from the auctioneer was processed
successfully.
 - FINALIZED: The OrderMatchFinalize message from the auctioneer was processed
successfully.

matched_orders.description: The set of all orders matched in the batch.

clearing_price_rate.description:
The uniform clearing price rate in parts per billion that was used for this
batch.

ask.description: The full ask order that was matched.

bid.description: The full bid order that was matched.

matching_rate.description: The fixed rate premium that was matched, expressed in parts-ber-billion.

total_sats_cleared.description: The total number of satoshis that were bought.

units_matched.description: The total number of units that were matched.

conf_target.description:
The confirmation target the auctioneer will use for fee estimation of the
next batch.

fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description:
The fee rate, in satoshis per kiloweight, estimated by the auctioneer to use
for the next batch.

clear_timestamp.description:
The absolute unix timestamp in seconds at which the auctioneer will attempt
to clear the next batch.

node_pubkey.description: The pubkey for the node these ratings belong to.

node_tier.description: The tier of the target node.

node_ratings.description: A series of node ratings for each of the queried nodes.

poolrpcNodeTier.description:
- TIER_DEFAULT: The default node tier. This value will be determined at run-time by the
current order version.
 - TIER_0: Tier 0, bid with this tier are opting out of the smaller "higher
quality" pool of nodes to match their bids. Nodes in this tier are
considered to have "no rating".
 - TIER_1: Tier 1, the "base" node tier. Nodes in this tier are shown to have a
higher degree of up time and route-ability compared to the rest of the
nodes in the network. This is the current default node tier when
submitting bid orders.

channel_capacity_sat.description:
The total channel capacity in satoshis. This will be used for the bid
order's amount and min channel/match size values.

self_chan_balance.description:
The number of satoshis that will be pushed to the recipient in the sidecar
channel resulting from the bid order submitted by the offering trader
(=provider). The initial outbound channel balance will be transferred from
the provider's pool account (=taker account) to the maker's account to
reimburse them for the balance they'll effectively be giving away. The
reimbursement between the recipient of the sidecar channel and the provider
(=taker) is _not_ part of the protocol and must happen out of band. The
sidecar protocol simply deducts all fees for the sidecar channel (execution
fee, lease premium, chain fees, push amount) from the taker's trading
account.

lease_duration_blocks.description: The number of blocks the resulting leased channel should be open for.

trader_key.description: The trader's account key of the account that is used for the order.

rate_fixed.description: Fixed order rate in parts per billion.

max_batch_fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description:
Maximum fee rate the trader is willing to pay for the batch transaction,
expressed in satoshis per 1000 weight units (sat/KW).

order_nonce.description: Order nonce, acts as unique order identifier.

state.description: The state the order currently is in.

units.description: The number of order units the amount corresponds to.

units_unfulfilled.description:
The number of currently unfilled units of this order. This will be equal to
the total amount of units until the order has reached the state PARTIAL_FILL
or EXECUTED.

reserved_value_sat.description:
The value reserved from the account by this order to ensure the account
can pay execution and chain fees in case it gets matched.

creation_timestamp_ns.description: The unix timestamp in nanoseconds the order was first created/submitted.

events.description:
A list of events that were emitted for this order. This field is only set
when the verbose flag is set to true in the request.

min_units_match.description: The minimum number of order units that must be matched per order pair.

timestamp_ns.description:
The unix timestamp in nanoseconds the event was emitted at. This is the
primary key of the event and is unique across the database.

event_str.description: The human readable representation of the event.

state_change.description: The order was updated in the database.

matched.description: The order was involved in a match making attempt.

txid.description: Raw bytes representing the transaction id.

output_index.description: The index of the output on the transaction.

value_sat.description: The value, in satoshis, of the output.

address.description: The address corresponding to the output.
The address corresponding to the output.

conf_target.description: The target number of blocks that the transaction should be confirmed in.

fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description: The fee rate, in satoshis per kw, to use for the withdrawal transaction.

conf_target.description: The target number of blocks that the transaction should be confirmed in.

num_recovered_accounts.description: The number of accounts that were recovered.

ticket.description:
The sidecar ticket to register and add the node and channel funding
information to. The ticket must be in the state "offered".

account_key.description: The key associated with the account to renew.

absolute_expiry.description: The new absolute expiration height of the account.

relative_expiry.description: The new relative expiration height of the account.

fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description: The fee rate, in satoshis per kw, to use for the renewal transaction.

account.description: The state of the account after processing the renewal.

renewal_txid.description: The transaction used to renew the expiration of the account.

ticket.description:
The complete sidecar ticket in its string encoded form which is base64 URL
encoded, has a human readable prefix ('sidecar...') and a checksum built in.
The string encoded version will only be used on the trader side of the API.
All requests to the auctioneer expect the ticket to be in its raw, tlv
encoded byte form.

initiator.description:
An optional identification string that will be appended to the user agent
string sent to the server to give information about the usage of pool. This
initiator part is meant for user interfaces to add their name to give the
full picture of the binary used (poold, LiT) and the method used for
submitting the order (pool CLI, LiT UI, other 3rd party UI).

invalid_order.description: Order failed with the given reason.

accepted_order_nonce.description: The order nonce of the accepted order.

tokens.description:
*
List of all tokens the daemon knows of, including old/expired tokens.

previous_state.description:
The state of the order previous to the change. This is what the state
changed from.

new_state.description:
The new state of the order after the change. This is what the state changed
to.

units_filled.description: The units that were filled at the time of the event.

trader_key.description:
The trader key associated with the account that funds will be withdrawed
from.

outputs.description: The outputs we'll withdraw funds from the account into.

fee_rate_sat_per_kw.description: The fee rate, in satoshis per kw, to use for the withdrawal transaction.

account.description: The state of the account after processing the withdrawal.

withdraw_txid.description: The transaction used to withdraw funds from the account.
